   21: %%
   22: -module(guard_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   25: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   26: 	 init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   27: 	 bad_arith/1,bad_tuple/1,test_heap_guards/1,guard_bifs/1,
   28: 	 type_tests/1,const_guard/1,
   29: 	 const_cond/1,basic_not/1,complex_not/1,
   30: 	 semicolon/1,complex_semicolon/1,comma/1,
   31: 	 or_guard/1,more_or_guards/1,
   32: 	 complex_or_guards/1,and_guard/1,
   33: 	 xor_guard/1,more_xor_guards/1,
   34: 	 old_guard_tests/1,
   35: 	 build_in_guard/1,gbif/1,
   36: 	 t_is_boolean/1,is_function_2/1,
   37: 	 tricky/1,rel_ops/1,
   38: 	 basic_andalso_orelse/1,traverse_dcd/1,
   39: 	 check_qlc_hrl/1,andalso_semi/1,t_tuple_size/1,binary_part/1,
   40: 	 bad_constants/1]).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   43: 
   44: -export([init/4]).
   45: -import(lists, [member/2]).
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   49:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     cases().
   53: 
   54: groups() -> 
   55:     [].
   56: 
   57: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   61:     Config.
   62: 
   63: 
   64: cases() -> 
   65:     [bad_arith, bad_tuple, test_heap_guards, guard_bifs,
   66:      type_tests, const_guard, const_cond, basic_not,
   67:      complex_not, semicolon, complex_semicolon, comma,
   68:      or_guard, more_or_guards, complex_or_guards, and_guard,
   69:      xor_guard, more_xor_guards, build_in_guard,
   70:      old_guard_tests, gbif, t_is_boolean, is_function_2,
   71:      tricky, rel_ops, basic_andalso_orelse, traverse_dcd,
   72:      check_qlc_hrl, andalso_semi, t_tuple_size, binary_part,
   73:      bad_constants].
   74: 
   75: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   76:     test_lib:interpret(?MODULE),
   77:     Config.
   78: 
   79: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   80:     ok.
   81: 
   82: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   83:     test_lib:interpret(?MODULE),
   84:     true = lists:member(?MODULE, int:interpreted()),
   85:     Config.
   86: 
   87: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   88:     ok.
   89: 
   90: %% Test that a bad arithmetic operation in a guard works correctly.
   91: bad_arith(Config) when list(Config) ->
   92:     5 = bad_arith1(2, 3),
   93:     10 = bad_arith1(1, infinity),
   94:     10 = bad_arith1(infinity, 1),
   95:     42 = bad_div(24, 0),
   96:     ok.
   97: 
   98: bad_arith1(T1, T2) when T1+T2 < 10 ->
   99:     T1+T2;
  100: bad_arith1(_, _) ->
  101:     10.
  102: 
  103: bad_div(A, B) when A/B > 0 ->
  104:     A/B;
  105: bad_div(A, B) when A div B > 0 ->
  106:     A div B;
  107: bad_div(_A, _B) ->
  108:     42.
  109: 
  110: %% Test that bad arguments to element/2 are handled correctly.
  111: bad_tuple(Config) when list(Config) ->
  112:     error = bad_tuple1(a),
  113:     error = bad_tuple1({a, b}),
  114:     x = bad_tuple1({x, b}),
  115:     y = bad_tuple1({a, b, y}),
  116:     ok.
  117: 
  118: bad_tuple1(T) when element(1, T) == x -> x;
  119: bad_tuple1(T) when element(3, T) == y -> y;
  120: bad_tuple1(_) -> error.
  121: 
  122: %% .
  123: test_heap_guards(Config) when list(Config) ->
  124:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  125:     Tuple = {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx},
  126:     List = [a, list, is, built, here],
  127: 
  128:     try_fun(fun a_case/1, [Tuple], [Tuple]),
  129:     try_fun(fun a_case/1, [List], [List, List]),
  130:     try_fun(fun a_case/1, [a], [a]),
  131: 
  132:     try_fun(fun an_if/1, [Tuple], [Tuple]),
  133:     try_fun(fun an_if/1, [List], [List, List]),
  134:     try_fun(fun an_if/1, [a], [a]),
  135: 
  136:     try_fun(fun receive_test/1, [Tuple], [Tuple]),
  137:     try_fun(fun receive_test/1, [List], [List, List]),
  138:     try_fun(fun receive_test/1, [a], [a]),
  139:     ok.
  140: 
  141: a_case(V) ->
  142:     case V of
  143: 	T when T == {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx} ->
  144: 	    [T];
  145: 	L when L == [a, list, is, built, here] ->
  146: 	    [L, L];
  147: 	a ->
  148: 	    [a]
  149:     end.
  150: 
  151: an_if(V) ->
  152:     if
  153: 	V == {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx} ->
  154: 	    [V];
  155: 	V == [a, list, is, built, here] ->
  156: 	    [V, V];
  157: 	V == a ->
  158: 	    [a]
  159:     end.
  160: 
  161: receive_test(V) ->
  162:     self() ! V,
  163:     a_receive().
  164: 
  165: a_receive() ->
  166:     receive
  167: 	T when T == {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx} ->
  168: 	    [T];
  169: 	L when L == [a, list, is, built, here] ->
  170: 	    [L, L];
  171: 	a ->
  172: 	    [a]
  173:     end.
  174: 
  175: try_fun(Fun, Args, Result) ->
  176:     try_fun(16, Fun, Args, Result, []).
  177: 
  178: try_fun(0, _, _, _, _) ->
  179:     ok;
  180: try_fun(Iter, Fun, Args, Result, Filler) ->
  181:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, init, [self(),Fun,Args,list_to_tuple(Filler)]),
  182:     receive
  183: 	{'EXIT',Pid,{result,Result}} ->
  184: 	    try_fun(Iter-1, Fun, Args, Result, [0|Filler]);
  185: 	{'EXIT',Pid,{result,Other}} ->
  186: 	    io:format("Expected ~p; got ~p~n", [Result,Other]),
  187: 	    ct:fail(failed);
  188: 	Other ->
  189: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message,Other})
  190:     end.
  191: 
  192: init(_ReplyTo, Fun, Args, Filler) ->
  193:     Result = {result, apply(Fun, Args)},
  194:     dummy(Filler),
  195:     io:format("~p: result = ~p\n", [?LINE,Result]),
  196:     exit(Result).
  197: 
  198: dummy(_) ->
  199:     ok.
  200: 
  201: %% Test all guard bifs with nasty (but legal arguments).
  202: guard_bifs(Config) when list(Config) ->
  203:     Big = -237849247829874297658726487367328971246284736473821617265433,
  204:     Float = 387924.874,
  205: 
  206:     %% Succeeding use of guard bifs.
  207: 
  208:     try_gbif('abs/1', Big, -Big),
  209:     try_gbif('float/1', Big, float(Big)),
  210:     try_gbif('trunc/1', Float, 387924.0),
  211:     try_gbif('round/1', Float, 387925.0),
  212:     try_gbif('length/1', [], 0),
  213: 
  214:     try_gbif('length/1', [a], 1),
  215:     try_gbif('length/1', [a, b], 2),
  216:     try_gbif('length/1', lists:seq(0, 31), 32),
  217: 
  218:     try_gbif('hd/1', [a], a),
  219:     try_gbif('hd/1', [a, b], a),
  220: 
  221:     try_gbif('tl/1', [a], []),
  222:     try_gbif('tl/1', [a, b], [b]),
  223:     try_gbif('tl/1', [a, b, c], [b, c]),
  224: 
  225:     try_gbif('size/1', {}, 0),
  226:     try_gbif('size/1', {a}, 1),
  227:     try_gbif('size/1', {a, b}, 2),
  228:     try_gbif('size/1', {a, b, c}, 3),
  229:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([]), 0),
  230:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([1]), 1),
  231:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([1, 2]), 2),
  232:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([1, 2, 3]), 3),
  233: 
  234:     try_gbif('element/2', {x}, {1, x}),
  235:     try_gbif('element/2', {x, y}, {1, x}),
  236:     try_gbif('element/2', {x, y}, {2, y}),
  237: 
  238:     try_gbif('self/0', 0, self()),
  239:     try_gbif('node/0', 0, node()),
  240:     try_gbif('node/1', self(), node()),
  241: 
  242:     %% Failing use of guard bifs.
  243: 
  244:     try_fail_gbif('abs/1', Big, 1),
  245:     try_fail_gbif('abs/1', [], 1),
  246: 
  247:     try_fail_gbif('float/1', Big, 42),
  248:     try_fail_gbif('float/1', [], 42),
  249: 
  250:     try_fail_gbif('trunc/1', Float, 0.0),
  251:     try_fail_gbif('trunc/1', [], 0.0),
  252: 
  253:     try_fail_gbif('round/1', Float, 1.0),
  254:     try_fail_gbif('round/1', [], a),
  255: 
  256:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', [], 1),
  257:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', [a], 0),
  258:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', a, 0),
  259:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', {a}, 0),
  260: 
  261:     try_fail_gbif('hd/1', [], 0),
  262:     try_fail_gbif('hd/1', [a], x),
  263:     try_fail_gbif('hd/1', x, x),
  264: 
  265:     try_fail_gbif('tl/1', [], 0),
  266:     try_fail_gbif('tl/1', [a], x),
  267:     try_fail_gbif('tl/1', x, x),
  268: 
  269:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', {}, 1),
  270:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', [], 0),
  271:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', [a], 1),
  272: 
  273:     try_fail_gbif('element/2', {}, {1, x}),
  274:     try_fail_gbif('element/2', {x}, {1, y}),
  275:     try_fail_gbif('element/2', [], {1, z}),
  276: 
  277:     try_fail_gbif('self/0', 0, list_to_pid("<0.0.0>")),
  278:     try_fail_gbif('node/0', 0, xxxx),
  279:     try_fail_gbif('node/1', self(), xxx),
  280:     try_fail_gbif('node/1', yyy, xxx),
  281:     ok.
  282: 
  283: try_gbif(Id, X, Y) ->
  284:     case guard_bif(Id, X, Y) of
  285: 	{Id, X, Y} ->
  286: 	    io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- ok", [Id, X, Y]);
  287: 	Other ->
  288: 	    ok = io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- bad result: ~p\n",
  289: 			   [Id, X, Y, Other]),
  290: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  291:     end.
  292: 
  293: try_fail_gbif(Id, X, Y) ->
  294:     case catch guard_bif(Id, X, Y) of
  295: 	{'EXIT', {function_clause,[{?MODULE,guard_bif,[Id,X,Y],_}|_]}} ->
  296: 	    io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- ok", [Id,X,Y]);
  297: 	Other ->
  298: 	    ok = io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- bad result: ~p\n",
  299: 			   [Id, X, Y, Other]),
  300: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  301:     end.
  302: 
  303: guard_bif('abs/1', X, Y) when abs(X) == Y ->
  304:     {'abs/1', X, Y};
  305: guard_bif('float/1', X, Y) when float(X) == Y ->
  306:     {'float/1', X, Y};
  307: guard_bif('trunc/1', X, Y) when trunc(X) == Y ->
  308:     {'trunc/1', X, Y};
  309: guard_bif('round/1', X, Y) when round(X) == Y ->
  310:     {'round/1', X, Y};
  311: guard_bif('length/1', X, Y) when length(X) == Y ->
  312:     {'length/1', X, Y};
  313: guard_bif('hd/1', X, Y) when hd(X) == Y ->
  314:     {'hd/1', X, Y};
  315: guard_bif('tl/1', X, Y) when tl(X) == Y ->
  316:     {'tl/1', X, Y};
  317: guard_bif('size/1', X, Y) when size(X) == Y ->
  318:     {'size/1', X, Y};
  319: guard_bif('element/2', X, {Pos, Expected}) when element(Pos, X) == Expected ->
  320:     {'element/2', X, {Pos, Expected}};
  321: guard_bif('self/0', X, Y) when self() == Y ->
  322:     {'self/0', X, Y};
  323: guard_bif('node/0', X, Y) when node() == Y ->
  324:     {'node/0', X, Y};
  325: guard_bif('node/1', X, Y) when node(X) == Y ->
  326:     {'node/1', X, Y}.
  327: 
  328: %% Test the type tests.
  329: type_tests(Config) when list(Config) ->
  330:     Types = all_types(),
  331:     Tests = type_test_desc(),
  332:     put(errors, 0),
  333:     put(violations, 0),
  334:     type_tests(Tests, Types),
  335:     case {get(errors), get(violations)} of
  336: 	{0, 0} ->
  337: 	    ok;
  338: 	{0, N} ->
  339: 	    {comment, integer_to_list(N) ++ " standard violation(s)"};
  340: 	{Errors, Violations} ->
  341: 	    io:format("~p sub test(s) failed, ~p violation(s)",
  342: 		      [Errors, Violations]),
  343: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  344:     end.
  345: 
  346: type_tests([{Test, AllowedTypes}| T], AllTypes) ->
  347:     type_tests(Test, AllTypes, AllowedTypes),
  348:     type_tests(T, AllTypes);
  349: type_tests([], _) ->
  350:     ok.
  351: 
  352: type_tests(Test, [Type|T], Allowed) ->
  353:     {TypeTag, Value} = Type,
  354:     case member(TypeTag, Allowed) of
  355: 	true ->
  356: 	    case catch type_test(Test, Value) of
  357: 		Test ->
  358: 		    ok;
  359: 		_Other ->
  360: 		    io:format("Test ~p(~p) failed", [Test, Value]),
  361: 		    put(errors, get(errors) + 1)
  362: 	    end;
  363: 	false ->
  364: 	    case catch type_test(Test, Value) of
  365: 		{'EXIT',{function_clause,
  366: 			 [{?MODULE,type_test,[Test,Value],_}|_]}} ->
  367: 		    ok;
  368: 		{'EXIT',Other} ->
  369: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_error_reason,Other});
  370: 		tuple when function(Value) ->
  371: 		    io:format("Standard violation: Test ~p(~p) should fail",
  372: 			      [Test, Value]),
  373: 		    put(violations, get(violations) + 1);
  374: 		_Other ->
  375: 		    io:format("Test ~p(~p) succeeded (should fail)", [Test, Value]),
  376: 		    put(errors, get(errors) + 1)
  377: 	    end
  378:     end,
  379:     type_tests(Test, T, Allowed);
  380: type_tests(_, [], _) ->
  381:     ok.
  382: 
  383: all_types() ->
  384:     [{small, 42},
  385:      {big, 392742928742947293873938792874019287447829874290742},
  386:      {float, 3.14156},
  387:      {nil, []},
  388:      {cons, [a]},
  389:      {tuple, {a, b}},
  390:      {atom, xxxx},
  391:      {ref, make_ref()},
  392:      {pid, self()},
  393:      {port, make_port()},
  394:      {function, fun(X) -> X+1, "" end},
  395:      {binary, list_to_binary([])}].
  396: 
  397: type_test_desc() ->
  398:     [{integer, [small, big]},
  399:      {float, [float]},
  400:      {number, [small, big, float]},
  401:      {atom, [atom]},
  402:      {list, [cons, nil]},
  403:      {nonempty_list, [cons]},
  404:      {nil, [nil]},
  405:      {tuple, [tuple]},
  406:      {pid, [pid]},
  407:      {port, [port]},
  408:      {reference, [ref]},
  409:      {function, [function]}].
  410: 
  411: type_test(integer, X) when integer(X) ->
  412:     integer;
  413: type_test(float, X) when float(X) ->
  414:     float;
  415: type_test(number, X) when number(X) ->
  416:     number;
  417: type_test(atom, X) when atom(X) ->
  418:     atom;
  419: type_test(list, X) when list(X) ->
  420:     list;
  421: type_test(nonempty_list, [_]) ->
  422:     nonempty_list;
  423: type_test(nil, []) ->
  424:     nil;
  425: type_test(tuple, X) when tuple(X) ->
  426:     tuple;
  427: type_test(pid, X) when pid(X) ->
  428:     pid;
  429: type_test(reference, X) when reference(X) ->
  430:     reference;
  431: type_test(port, X) when port(X) ->
  432:     port;
  433: type_test(binary, X) when binary(X) ->
  434:     binary;
  435: type_test(function, X) when function(X) ->
  436:     function.
  437: 
  438: make_port() ->
  439:     hd(erlang:ports()).
  440: 
  441: const_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  442:     if
  443: 	(0 == 0) and ((0 == 0) or (0 == 0)) ->
  444: 	    ok
  445:     end.
  446: 
  447: 
  448: const_cond(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  449:     ok = const_cond({}, 0),
  450:     ok = const_cond({a}, 1),
  451:     error = const_cond({a,b}, 3),
  452:     error = const_cond({a}, 0),
  453:     error = const_cond({a,b}, 1),
  454:     ok.
  455: 
  456: const_cond(T, Sz) ->
  457:     case T of
  458: 	_X when false -> never;
  459: 	_X when tuple(T), eq == eq, size(T) == Sz -> ok;
  460: 	_X when tuple(T), eq == leq, size(T) =< Sz -> ok;
  461: 	_X -> error
  462:     end.
  463: 
  464: basic_not(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  465:     True = id(true),
  466:     False = id(false),
  467:     Glurf = id(glurf),
  468:     A = id(5),
  469:     B = id(37.5),
  470:     C = id(-1),
  471:     D = id(5),
  472:     ATuple = {False,True,Glurf},
  473: 
  474:     check(fun() -> if not false -> ok; true -> error end end, ok),
  475:     check(fun() -> if not true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  476:     check(fun() -> if not False -> ok; true -> error end end, ok),
  477:     check(fun() -> if not True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  478: 
  479:     check(fun() -> if A > B -> gt; A < B -> lt; A == B -> eq end end, lt),
  480:     check(fun() -> if A > C -> gt; A < C -> lt; A == C -> eq end end, gt),
  481:     check(fun() -> if A > D -> gt; A < D -> lt; A == D -> eq end end, eq),
  482: 
  483:     check(fun() -> if not (7 > 453) -> le; not (7 < 453) -> ge;
  484: 		      not (7 == 453) -> ne; true -> eq end end, le),
  485:     check(fun() -> if not (7 > -8) -> le; not (7 < -8) -> ge;
  486: 		      not (7 == -8) -> ne; true -> eq end end, ge),
  487:     check(fun() -> if not (7 > 7) -> le; not (7 < 7) -> ge;
  488: 		      not (7 == 7) -> ne; true -> eq end end, le),
  489: 
  490:     check(fun() -> if not (A > B) -> le; not (A < B) -> ge;
  491: 		      not (A == B) -> ne; true -> eq end end, le),
  492:     check(fun() -> if not (A > C) -> le; not (A < C) -> ge;
  493: 		      not (A == C) -> ne; true -> eq end end, ge),
  494:     check(fun() -> if not (A > D) -> le; not (A < D) -> ge;
  495: 		      not (A == D) -> ne; true -> eq end end, le),
  496: 
  497:     check(fun() -> if not element(1, ATuple) -> ok; true -> error end end, ok),
  498:     check(fun() -> if not element(2, ATuple) -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  499:     check(fun() -> if not element(3, ATuple) -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  500: 
  501:     check(fun() -> if not glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  502:     check(fun() -> if not Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  503: 
  504:     ok.
  505: 
  506: complex_not(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  507:     ATuple = id({false,true,gurka}),
  508:     check(fun() -> if not(element(1, ATuple)) -> ok; true -> error end end, ok),
  509:     check(fun() -> if not(element(2, ATuple)) -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  510: 
  511:     check(fun() -> if not(element(3, ATuple) == gurka) -> ok;
  512: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  513:     check(fun() -> if not(element(3, ATuple) =/= gurka) -> ok;
  514: 		      true -> error end end, ok),
  515: 
  516:     check(fun() -> if {a,not(element(2, ATuple))} == {a,false} -> ok;
  517: 		      true -> error end end, ok),
  518:     check(fun() -> if {a,not(element(1, ATuple))} == {a,false} -> ok;
  519: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  520: 
  521:     check(fun() -> if not(element(1, ATuple) or element(3, ATuple)) -> ok;
  522: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  523: 
  524:     %% orelse
  525:     check(fun() -> if not(element(1, ATuple) orelse element(3, ATuple)) -> ok;
  526: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  527: 
  528:     ok.
  529: 
  530: semicolon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  531: 
  532:     %% True/false combined using ';' (literal atoms).
  533: 
  534:     check(fun() -> if true; false -> ok end end, ok),
  535:     check(fun() -> if false; true -> ok end end, ok),
  536:     check(fun() -> if true; true -> ok end end, ok),
  537:     check(fun() -> if false; false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  538:     check(fun() ->
  539: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if false; false -> ok end),
  540: 		  exit
  541: 	  end, exit),
  542: 
  543:     %% True/false combined used ';'.
  544: 
  545:     True = id(true),
  546:     False = id(false),
  547: 
  548:     check(fun() -> if True; False -> ok end end, ok),
  549:     check(fun() -> if False; True -> ok end end, ok),
  550:     check(fun() -> if True; True -> ok end end, ok),
  551:     check(fun() -> if False; False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  552:     check(fun() ->
  553: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if False; False -> ok end),
  554: 		  exit
  555: 	  end, exit),
  556: 
  557:     %% Combine true/false with a non-boolean value.
  558:     Glurf = id(glurf),
  559: 
  560: 
  561:     check(fun() -> if True; Glurf -> ok end end, ok),
  562:     check(fun() -> if Glurf; True -> ok end end, ok),
  563:     check(fun() -> if Glurf; Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  564:     check(fun() -> if False; Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  565:     check(fun() -> if Glurf; False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  566:     check(fun() ->
  567: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if Glurf; Glurf -> ok end),
  568: 		  exit
  569: 	  end, exit),
  570: 
  571:     %% Combine true/false with errors.
  572: 
  573:     ATuple = id({false,true,gurka}),
  574: 
  575:     check(fun() -> if True; element(42, ATuple) -> ok end end, ok),
  576:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple); True -> ok end end, ok),
  577:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple); element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  578: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  579:     check(fun() -> if False; element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  580: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  581:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple);
  582: 		      False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  583:     check(fun() ->
  584: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  585: 		      (catch if element(42, ATuple);
  586: 				element(42, ATuple) -> ok end),
  587: 		  exit
  588: 	  end, exit),
  589: 
  590:     ok.
  591: 
  592: complex_semicolon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  593:     ok = csemi1(int, {blurf}),
  594:     ok = csemi1(string, {blurf}),
  595:     ok = csemi1(float, [a]),
  596:     error = csemi1(35, 42),
  597: 
  598:     %% 2
  599:     ok = csemi2({}, {a,b,c}),
  600:     ok = csemi2({1,3.5}, {a,b,c}),
  601:     ok = csemi2(dum, {a,b,c}),
  602: 
  603:     ok = csemi2({45,-19.3}, {}),
  604:     ok = csemi2({45,-19.3}, {dum}),
  605:     ok = csemi2({45,-19.3}, {dum,dum}),
  606: 
  607:     error = csemi2({45}, {dum}),
  608:     error = csemi2([], {dum}),
  609:     error = csemi2({dum}, []),
  610:     error = csemi2([], []),
  611: 
  612:     %% 3
  613:     csemi3(fun csemi3a/4),
  614:     csemi3(fun csemi3b/4),
  615:     csemi3(fun csemi3c/4),
  616: 
  617:     %% 4
  618:     csemi4(fun csemi4a/4),
  619:     csemi4(fun csemi4b/4),
  620:     csemi4(fun csemi4c/4),
  621:     csemi4(fun csemi4d/4),
  622: 
  623:     %% 4, 'orelse' instead of 'or'
  624:     csemi4_orelse(fun csemi4_orelse_a/4),
  625:     csemi4_orelse(fun csemi4_orelse_b/4),
  626:     csemi4_orelse(fun csemi4_orelse_c/4),
  627:     csemi4_orelse(fun csemi4_orelse_d/4),
  628: 
  629:     ok.
  630: 
  631: csemi1(Type, Val) when is_list(Val), Type == float;
  632: 		       Type == int; Type == string -> ok;
  633: csemi1(_, _) -> error.
  634: 
  635: csemi2(A, B) when size(A) > 1; size(B) > 2 -> ok;
  636: csemi2(_, _) -> error.
  637: 
  638: csemi3(Csemi3) ->
  639:     ok = Csemi3({}, {a,b,c}, [0], [0]),
  640:     ok = Csemi3({1,3.5}, {a,b,c}, -1, -1),
  641:     ok = Csemi3(dum, {a,b,c}, 0.0, 0.0),
  642:     ok = Csemi3(dum, {c}, b, a),
  643:     ok = Csemi3(dum, <<1,2,3>>, 0.0, 0.0),
  644:     ok = Csemi3(<<3.5/float>>, {a,b,c}, -1, -1),
  645: 
  646:     ok = Csemi3({45,-19.3}, {}, [], []),
  647:     ok = Csemi3({45,-19.3}, {dum}, 42, 42),
  648:     ok = Csemi3({45,-19.3}, {dum,dum}, 33, 33),
  649: 
  650:     ok = Csemi3({45}, {dum}, 1.0, 0),
  651:     ok = Csemi3([a], {dum}, 1.0, 0),
  652:     ok = Csemi3({dum}, [], 1.0, 0),
  653:     ok = Csemi3([], [], 1.0, 0),
  654:     ok = Csemi3(blurf, {dum}, 1.0, 0),
  655:     ok = Csemi3({a}, blurf, 1.0, 0),
  656:     ok = Csemi3([a], [dum], 1.0, 0),
  657:     ok = Csemi3({dum}, [], 1.0, 0),
  658:     ok = Csemi3([], [], 1.0, 0),
  659: 
  660:     error = Csemi3({45}, {dum}, 0, 0),
  661:     error = Csemi3([a], {dum}, 0, 0),
  662:     error = Csemi3({dum}, [], 0, 0),
  663:     error = Csemi3([], [], 0, 0),
  664:     ok.
  665: 
  666: csemi3a(A, B, X, Y) when X > Y; size(A) > 1; size(B) > 2 -> ok;
  667: csemi3a(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  668: 
  669: csemi3b(A, B, X, Y) when size(A) > 1; X > Y; size(B) > 2 -> ok;
  670: csemi3b(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  671: 
  672: csemi3c(A, B, X, Y) when size(A) > 1; size(B) > 2; X > Y -> ok;
  673: csemi3c(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  674: 
  675: 
  676: csemi4(Test) ->
  677:     ok = Test({a,b}, 2, {c,d}, 2),
  678:     ok = Test({1,2,3}, 0, [], 0),
  679:     ok = Test({}, 2, blurf, 0),
  680:     ok = Test({}, 2, {1}, 2),
  681: 
  682:     error = Test([], 4, {}, 0),
  683:     error = Test({}, 0, [a,b], 4),
  684:     error = Test({}, 0, [a,b], 0),
  685:     error = Test([], 0, {}, 0),
  686:     error = Test({}, 0, {}, 0),
  687: 
  688:     ok.
  689: 
  690: csemi4a(A, X, B, Y) when (size(A) > 1) or (X > 1);
  691: 			 (size(B) > 1) or (Y > 1) -> ok;
  692: csemi4a(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  693: 
  694: csemi4b(A, X, B, Y) when (X > 1) or (size(A) > 1);
  695: 			 (size(B) > 1) or (Y > 1) -> ok;
  696: csemi4b(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  697: 
  698: csemi4c(A, X, B, Y) when (size(A) > 1) or (X > 1);
  699: 			 (Y > 1) or (size(B) > 1) -> ok;
  700: csemi4c(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  701: 
  702: csemi4d(A, X, B, Y) when (X > 1) or (size(A) > 1);
  703: 			 (Y > 1) or (size(B) > 1) -> ok;
  704: csemi4d(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  705: 
  706: 
  707: csemi4_orelse(Test) ->
  708:     ok = Test({a,b}, 2, {c,d}, 2),
  709:     ok = Test({1,2,3}, 0, [], 0),
  710:     ok = Test({}, 2, blurf, 0),
  711:     ok = Test({}, 2, {1}, 2),
  712: 
  713:     error = Test([], 1, {}, 0),
  714: 
  715:     ok.
  716: 
  717: csemi4_orelse_a(A, X, B, Y) when (size(A) > 1) orelse (X > 1);
  718: 				 (size(B) > 1) orelse (Y > 1) -> ok;
  719: csemi4_orelse_a(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  720: 
  721: csemi4_orelse_b(A, X, B, Y) when (X > 1) orelse (size(A) > 1);
  722: 				 (size(B) > 1) orelse (Y > 1) -> ok;
  723: csemi4_orelse_b(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  724: 
  725: csemi4_orelse_c(A, X, B, Y) when (size(A) > 1) orelse (X > 1);
  726: 				 (Y > 1) orelse (size(B) > 1) -> ok;
  727: csemi4_orelse_c(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  728: 
  729: csemi4_orelse_d(A, X, B, Y) when (X > 1) or (size(A) > 1);
  730: 				 (Y > 1) or (size(B) > 1) -> ok;
  731: csemi4_orelse_d(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  732: 
  733: 
  734: comma(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  735: 
  736:     %% ',' combinations of literal true/false.
  737: 
  738:     check(fun() -> if true, false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  739:     check(fun() -> if false, true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  740:     check(fun() -> if true, true -> ok end end, ok),
  741:     check(fun() -> if false, false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  742:     check(fun() ->
  743: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  744: 		      (catch if true, false -> ok;
  745: 				false, true -> ok;
  746: 				false, false -> ok
  747: 			     end),
  748: 		  exit
  749: 	  end, exit),
  750: 
  751:     %% ',' combinations of true/false in variables.
  752: 
  753:     True = id(true),
  754:     False = id(false),
  755: 
  756:     check(fun() -> if True, False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  757:     check(fun() -> if False, True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  758:     check(fun() -> if True, True -> ok end end, ok),
  759:     check(fun() -> if False, False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  760:     check(fun() ->
  761: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  762: 		      (catch if True, False -> ok;
  763: 				False, True -> ok;
  764: 				False, False -> ok
  765: 			     end),
  766: 		  exit
  767: 	  end, exit),
  768: 
  769:     %% ',' combinations of true/false, and non-boolean in variables.
  770: 
  771:     Glurf = id(glurf),
  772: 
  773:     check(fun() -> if True, Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  774:     check(fun() -> if Glurf, True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  775:     check(fun() -> if True, True -> ok end end, ok),
  776:     check(fun() -> if Glurf, Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  777:     check(fun() ->
  778: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  779: 		      (catch if True, Glurf -> ok;
  780: 				Glurf, True -> ok;
  781: 				Glurf, Glurf -> ok
  782: 			     end),
  783: 		  exit
  784: 	  end, exit),
  785: 
  786:     %% ',' combinations of true/false with errors.
  787:     ATuple = id({a,b,c}),
  788: 
  789:     check(fun() -> if True, element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  790: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  791:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple), True -> ok;
  792: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  793:     check(fun() -> if True, True -> ok end end, ok),
  794:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple), element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  795: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  796:     check(fun() ->
  797: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  798: 		      (catch if True, element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  799: 				element(42, ATuple), True -> ok;
  800: 				element(42, ATuple), element(42, ATuple) -> ok
  801: 			     end),
  802: 		  exit
  803: 	  end, exit),
  804: 
  805:     ok.
  806: 
  807: or_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  808:     True = id(true),
  809:     False = id(false),
  810:     Glurf = id(glurf),
  811: 
  812:     %% 'or' combinations of literal true/false.
  813:     check(fun() -> if true or false -> ok end end, ok),
  814:     check(fun() -> if false or true -> ok end end, ok),
  815:     check(fun() -> if true or true -> ok end end, ok),
  816:     check(fun() -> if false or false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  817: 
  818:     check(fun() -> if glurf or true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  819:     check(fun() -> if true or glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  820:     check(fun() -> if glurf or glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  821: 
  822:     check(fun() ->
  823: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if false or false -> ok end),
  824: 		  exit
  825: 	  end, exit),
  826: 
  827: 
  828:     %% 'or' combinations using variables containing true/false.
  829:     check(fun() -> if True or False -> ok end end, ok),
  830:     check(fun() -> if False or True -> ok end end, ok),
  831:     check(fun() -> if True or True -> ok end end, ok),
  832:     check(fun() -> if False or False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  833: 
  834:     check(fun() -> if True or Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  835:     check(fun() -> if Glurf or True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  836:     check(fun() -> if Glurf or Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  837: 
  838:     check(fun() ->
  839: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if False or False -> ok end),
  840: 		  exit
  841: 	  end, exit),
  842: 
  843:     ok.
  844: 
  845: more_or_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  846:     True = id(true),
  847:     False = id(false),
  848:     ATuple = id({false,true,gurka}),
  849: 
  850:     check(fun() ->
  851: 		  if element(42, ATuple) or False -> ok;
  852: 		     true -> error end
  853: 	  end, error),
  854: 
  855:     check(fun() ->
  856: 		  if False or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  857: 		     true -> error end
  858: 	  end, error),
  859: 
  860:     check(fun() ->
  861: 		  if element(18, ATuple) or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  862: 		     true -> error end
  863: 	  end, error),
  864: 
  865:     check(fun() ->
  866: 		  if True or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  867: 		     true -> error end
  868: 	  end, error),
  869: 
  870:     check(fun() ->
  871: 		  if element(42, ATuple) or True -> ok;
  872: 		     true -> error end
  873: 	  end, error),
  874: 
  875:     check(fun() ->
  876: 		  if element(1, ATuple) or element(42, ATuple) or True -> ok;
  877: 		     true -> error end
  878: 	  end, error),
  879: 
  880:     check(fun() ->
  881: 		  if element(1, ATuple) or True or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  882: 		     true -> error end
  883: 	  end, error),
  884: 
  885:     check(fun() ->
  886: 		  if
  887: 		      (<<False:8>> == <<0>>) or element(2, ATuple) -> ok;
  888: 		      true -> error end
  889: 	  end, error),
  890: 
  891:     check(fun() ->
  892: 		  if
  893: 		      element(2, ATuple) or (<<True:8>> == <<1>>) -> ok;
  894: 		      true -> error end
  895: 	  end, error),
  896: 
  897:     check(fun() ->
  898: 		  if element(2, ATuple) or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  899: 		     true -> error end
  900: 	  end, error),
  901: 
  902:     check(fun() ->
  903: 		  if
  904: 		      element(1, ATuple) or
  905: 		      element(2, ATuple) or
  906: 		      element(19, ATuple) -> ok;
  907: 		      true -> error end
  908: 	  end, error),
  909:     ok.
  910: 
  911: complex_or_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  912:     %% complex_or_1/2
  913:     ok = complex_or_1({a,b,c,d}, {1,2,3}),
  914:     ok = complex_or_1({a,b,c,d}, {1}),
  915:     ok = complex_or_1({a}, {1,2,3}),
  916:     error = complex_or_1({a}, {1}),
  917: 
  918:     error = complex_or_1(1, 2),
  919:     error = complex_or_1([], {a,b,c,d}),
  920:     error = complex_or_1({a,b,c,d}, []),
  921: 
  922: 
  923:     %% complex_or_2/1
  924:     ok = complex_or_2({true,{}}),
  925:     ok = complex_or_2({false,{a}}),
  926:     ok = complex_or_2({false,{a,b,c}}),
  927:     ok = complex_or_2({true,{a,b,c,d}}),
  928: 
  929:     error = complex_or_2({blurf,{a,b,c}}),
  930: 
  931:     error = complex_or_2({true}),
  932:     error = complex_or_2({true,no_tuple}),
  933:     error = complex_or_2({true,[]}),
  934: 
  935:     %% complex_or_3/2
  936:     ok = complex_or_3({true}, {}),
  937:     ok = complex_or_3({false}, {a}),
  938:     ok = complex_or_3({false}, {a,b,c}),
  939:     ok = complex_or_3({true}, {a,b,c,d}),
  940:     ok = complex_or_3({false}, <<1,2,3>>),
  941:     ok = complex_or_3({true}, <<1,2,3,4>>),
  942: 
  943:     error = complex_or_3(blurf, {a,b,c}),
  944: 
  945:     error = complex_or_3({false}, <<1,2,3,4>>),
  946:     error = complex_or_3([], <<1,2>>),
  947:     error = complex_or_3({true}, 45),
  948:     error = complex_or_3(<<>>, <<>>),
  949: 
  950:     %% complex_or_4/2
  951:     ok = complex_or_4(<<1,2,3>>, {true}),
  952:     ok = complex_or_4(<<1,2,3>>, {false}),
  953:     ok = complex_or_4(<<1,2,3>>, {true}),
  954:     ok = complex_or_4({1,2,3}, {true}),
  955:     error = complex_or_4({1,2,3,4}, {false}),
  956: 
  957:     error = complex_or_4(<<1,2,3,4>>, []),
  958:     error = complex_or_4([], {true}),
  959: 
  960:     %% complex_or_5/2
  961:     ok = complex_or_5(<<1>>, {false}),
  962:     ok = complex_or_5(<<1,2,3>>, {true}),
  963:     ok = complex_or_5(<<1,2,3,4>>, {false}),
  964:     ok = complex_or_5({1,2,3}, {false}),
  965:     ok = complex_or_5({1,2,3,4}, {false}),
  966: 
  967:     error = complex_or_5(blurf, {false}),
  968:     error = complex_or_5(<<1>>, klarf),
  969:     error = complex_or_5(blurf, klarf),
  970: 
  971:     %% complex_or_6/2
  972:     ok = complex_or_6({true,true}, {1,2,3,4}),
  973:     ok = complex_or_6({true,true}, <<1,2,3,4>>),
  974:     ok = complex_or_6({false,false}, <<1,2,3,4>>),
  975:     ok = complex_or_6({false,true}, <<1>>),
  976:     ok = complex_or_6({true,false}, {1}),
  977:     ok = complex_or_6({true,true}, {1}),
  978: 
  979:     error = complex_or_6({false,false}, {1}),
  980: 
  981:     error = complex_or_6({true}, {1,2,3,4}),
  982:     error = complex_or_6({}, {1,2,3,4}),
  983:     error = complex_or_6([], {1,2,3,4}),
  984:     error = complex_or_6([], {1,2,3,4}),
  985:     error = complex_or_6({true,false}, klurf),
  986: 
  987:     ok.
  988: 
  989: complex_or_1(A, B) ->
  990:     if
  991: 	((3 < size(A)) and (size(A) < 9)) or
  992: 	((2 < size(B)) and (size(B) < 7)) -> ok;
  993: 	true -> error
  994:     end.
  995: 
  996: complex_or_2(Tuple) ->
  997:     if
  998: 	element(1, Tuple) or not (size(element(2, Tuple)) > 3) -> ok;
  999: 	true -> error
 1000:     end.
 1001: 
 1002: complex_or_3(A, B) ->
 1003:     if
 1004: 	not (size(B) > 3) or element(1, A) -> ok;
 1005: 	true -> error
 1006:     end.
 1007: 
 1008: complex_or_4(A, B) ->
 1009:     if
 1010: 	not (is_tuple(A) and (size(A) > 3)) or element(1, B) -> ok;
 1011: 	true -> error
 1012:     end.
 1013: 
 1014: complex_or_5(A, B) ->
 1015:     if
 1016: 	not (is_tuple(A) or (size(A) > 3)) or not element(1, B) -> ok;
 1017: 	true -> error
 1018:     end.
 1019: 
 1020: complex_or_6(A, B) ->
 1021:     if
 1022: 	not (not element(1, A) and not element(2, A)) or
 1023: 	not (not (size(B) > 3)) -> ok;
 1024: 	true -> error
 1025:     end.
 1026: 
 1027: and_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1028: 
 1029:     %% 'and' combinations of literal true/false.
 1030: 
 1031:     check(fun() -> if true and false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1032:     check(fun() -> if false and true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1033:     check(fun() -> if true and true -> ok end end, ok),
 1034:     check(fun() -> if false and false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1035: 
 1036:     check(fun() -> if glurf and true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1037:     check(fun() -> if true and glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1038:     check(fun() -> if glurf and glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1039: 
 1040:     check(fun() ->
 1041: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
 1042: 		      (catch if true and false -> ok;
 1043: 				false and true -> ok;
 1044: 				false and false -> ok
 1045: 			     end),
 1046: 		  exit
 1047: 	  end, exit),
 1048: 
 1049:     %% 'and' combinations of true/false in variables.
 1050: 
 1051:     True = id(true),
 1052:     False = id(false),
 1053: 
 1054:     check(fun() -> if True and False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1055:     check(fun() -> if False and True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1056:     check(fun() -> if True and True -> ok end end, ok),
 1057:     check(fun() -> if False and False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1058:     check(fun() ->
 1059: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
 1060: 		      (catch if True and False -> ok;
 1061: 				False and True -> ok;
 1062: 				False and False -> ok
 1063: 			     end),
 1064: 		  exit
 1065: 	  end, exit),
 1066: 
 1067:     %% 'and' combinations of true/false and a non-boolean in variables.
 1068: 
 1069:     Glurf = id(glurf),
 1070: 
 1071:     check(fun() -> if True and Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1072:     check(fun() -> if Glurf and True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1073:     check(fun() -> if True and True -> ok end end, ok),
 1074:     check(fun() -> if Glurf and Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1075:     check(fun() ->
 1076: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
 1077: 		      (catch if True and Glurf -> ok;
 1078: 				Glurf and True -> ok;
 1079: 				Glurf and Glurf -> ok
 1080: 			     end),
 1081: 		  exit
 1082: 	  end, exit),
 1083: 
 1084:     %% 'and' combinations of true/false with errors.
 1085:     ATuple = id({a,b,c}),
 1086: 
 1087:     check(fun() -> if True and element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
 1088: 		      true -> error end end, error),
 1089:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple) and True -> ok;
 1090: 		      true -> error end end, error),
 1091:     check(fun() -> if True and True -> ok end end, ok),
 1092:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple) and element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
 1093: 		      true -> error end end, error),
 1094:     check(fun() ->
 1095: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
 1096: 		      (catch if True and element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
 1097: 				element(42, ATuple) and True -> ok;
 1098: 				element(42, ATuple) and element(42, ATuple) -> ok
 1099: 			     end),
 1100: 		  exit
 1101: 	  end, exit),
 1102: 
 1103:     ok = relprod({'Set',a,b}, {'Set',a,b}),
 1104: 
 1105:     ok.
 1106: 
 1107: relprod(R1, R2) when (erlang:size(R1) =:= 3) and (erlang:element(1,R1) =:= 'Set'), (erlang:size(R2) =:= 3) and (erlang:element(1,R2) =:= 'Set') ->
 1108:     ok.

 1111: xor_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1112: 
 1113:     %% 'xor' combinations of literal true/false.
 1114:     check(fun() -> if true xor false -> ok end end, ok),
 1115:     check(fun() -> if false xor true -> ok end end, ok),
 1116:     check(fun() -> if true xor true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1117:     check(fun() -> if false xor false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1118:     check(fun() ->
 1119: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if false xor false -> ok end),
 1120: 		  exit
 1121: 	  end, exit),
 1122:     check(fun() ->
 1123: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if true xor true -> ok end),
 1124: 		  exit
 1125: 	  end, exit),
 1126: 
 1127: 
 1128:     %% 'xor' combinations using variables containing true/false.
 1129: 
 1130:     True = id(true),
 1131:     False = id(false),
 1132: 
 1133:     check(fun() -> if True xor False -> ok end end, ok),
 1134:     check(fun() -> if False xor True -> ok end end, ok),
 1135:     check(fun() -> if True xor True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1136:     check(fun() -> if False xor False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1137:     check(fun() ->
 1138: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if False xor False -> ok end),
 1139: 		  exit
 1140: 	  end, exit),
 1141:     check(fun() ->
 1142: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if True xor True -> ok end),
 1143: 		  exit
 1144: 	  end, exit),
 1145: 
 1146:     ok.

 1187:     %% Check that all the old guard tests are still recognized.

 1190:     binary = og(<<1,2>>),
 1191:     float = og(3.14),
 1192:     integer = og(43),

 1201: 
 1202: og(V) when atom(V) -> atom;
 1203: og(V) when binary(V) -> binary;
 1204: og(V) when float(V) -> float;
 1205: og(V) when integer(V) -> integer;
 1206: og(V) when function(V) -> a_function;
 1207: og(V) when list(V) -> list;
 1208: og(V) when pid(V) -> pid;
 1209: og(V) when port(V) -> port;
 1210: og(V) when reference(V) -> reference;
 1211: og(V) when tuple(V) -> tuple;
 1212: og(_) -> what.

 1215: on(_) -> not_number.

 1308: -define(T(Op,A,B),
 1309: 	ok = if A Op B -> ok; true -> error end,
 1310: 	ok = if not (A Op B) -> error; true -> ok end,
 1311: 	(fun(X, Y, True, False) ->
 1312: 		 ok = if X Op Y -> ok; true -> error end,
 1313: 		 ok = if False; X Op Y; False -> ok; true -> error end,
 1314: 		 ok = if X Op Y, True -> ok; true -> error end,
 1315: 		 ok = if not (X Op Y) -> error; true -> ok end,
 1316: 		 ok = if False; not (X Op Y); False -> error; true -> ok end
 1317: 	 end)(id(A), id(B), id(true), id(false))).
 1318: 
 1319: -define(F(Op,A,B),
 1320: 	ok = if A Op B -> error; true -> ok end,
 1321: 	ok = if not (A Op B) -> ok; true -> error end,
 1322: 	(fun(X, Y, True, False) ->
 1323: 		 ok = if X Op Y -> error; true -> ok end,
 1324: 		 ok = if False; X Op Y; False -> error; true -> ok end,
 1325: 		 ok = if not (X Op Y); False -> ok; true -> error end,
 1326: 		 ok = if not (X Op Y), True -> ok; true -> error end
 1327: 	 end)(id(A), id(B), id(true), id(false))).

 1366: basic_andalso_orelse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1367:     T = id({type,integers,23,42}),
 1368:     65 = if
 1369: 	     ((element(1, T) =:= type) andalso (size(T) =:= 4) andalso
 1370: 	      element(2, T) == integers) ->
 1371: 		 element(3, T) + element(4, T);
 1372: 	     true -> error
 1373: 	 end,
 1374:     65 = case [] of
 1375: 	     [] when ((element(1, T) =:= type) andalso (size(T) =:= 4) andalso
 1376: 		      element(2, T) == integers) ->
 1377: 		 element(3, T) + element(4, T)
 1378: 	 end,
 1379: 
 1380:     42 = basic_rt({type,integers,40,2}),
 1381:     5.0 = basic_rt({vector,{3.0,4.0}}),
 1382:     20 = basic_rt(['+',3,7]),
 1383:     {'Set',a,b} = basic_rt({{'Set',a,b},{'Set',a,b}}),
 1384:     12 = basic_rt({klurf,4}),
 1385: 
 1386:     error = basic_rt({type,integers,40,2,3}),
 1387:     error = basic_rt({kalle,integers,40,2}),
 1388:     error = basic_rt({kalle,integers,40,2}),
 1389:     error = basic_rt({1,2}),
 1390:     error = basic_rt([]),
 1391: 
 1392:     RelProdBody =
 1393: 	fun(R1, R2) ->
 1394: 		if
 1395: 		    (erlang:size(R1) =:= 3) andalso (erlang:element(1,R1) =:= 'Set'),
 1396: 		    (erlang:size(R2) =:= 3) andalso (erlang:element(1,R2) =:= 'Set') ->
 1397: 			ok
 1398: 		end
 1399: 	end,
 1400: 
 1401:     ok = RelProdBody({'Set',a,b}, {'Set',a,b}),
 1402:     ok.
 1403: 
 1404: basic_rt(T) when is_tuple(T) andalso size(T) =:= 4 andalso element(1, T) =:= type andalso
 1405: 		 element(2, T) == integers ->
 1406:     element(3, T) + element(4, T);
 1407: basic_rt(T) when is_tuple(T) andalso size(T) =:= 2 andalso element(1, T) =:= vector ->
 1408:     {X,Y} = element(2, T),
 1409:     if
 1410: 	is_float(X), is_float(Y) ->
 1411: 	    math:sqrt(X*X+Y*Y)
 1412:     end;
 1413: basic_rt(['+',A,B]) ->
 1414:     2*id(A+B);
 1415: basic_rt({R1,R2}) when erlang:size(R1) =:= 3 andalso erlang:element(1,R1) =:= 'Set',
 1416: 		       erlang:size(R2) =:= 3 andalso erlang:element(1,R2) =:= 'Set' ->
 1417:     R1 = id(R1),
 1418:     R2 = id(R2),
 1419:     R1;
 1420: basic_rt(T) when is_tuple(T) andalso size(T) =:= 2 andalso element(1, T) =:= klurf ->
 1421:     3*id(element(2, T));
 1422: basic_rt(_) ->
 1423:     error.

 1425: traverse_dcd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1426:     L0 = [{log_header,dcd_log,"1.0",a,b,c},{log_header,dcd_log,"2.0",a,b,c},
 1427: 	  {log_header,dcd_log,"0.0",a,b,c},blurf],
 1428:     {cont,[{log_header,dcd_log,"0.0",a,b,c},blurf],log,funny} =
 1429: 	traverse_dcd({cont,L0}, log, funny),
 1430:     L1 = [{log_header,dcd_log,"1.0"}],
 1431:     {cont,L1,log,funny} = traverse_dcd({cont,L1}, log, funny),
 1432:     L2 = [{a,tuple}],
 1433:     {cont,L2,log,funny} = traverse_dcd({cont,L2}, log, funny),
 1434:     ok.
 1435: 
 1436: %% The function starts out with 3 arguments in {x,0}, {x,1}, {x,2}.
 1437: %% The outer match of a two tuple will places the first element in {x,3} and
 1438: %% second in {x,4}. The guard for the first clause must make ensure that all of those
 1439: %% registers are restored before entering the second clause.
 1440: %%
 1441: %% (From mnesia_checkpoint.erl, modified.)
 1442: 
 1443: traverse_dcd({Cont,[LogH|Rest]},Log,Fun)
 1444:   when is_tuple(LogH) andalso size(LogH) =:= 6 andalso element(1, LogH) =:= log_header
 1445:        andalso erlang:element(2,LogH) == dcd_log,
 1446:        is_tuple(LogH) andalso size(LogH) =:= 6 andalso element(1, LogH) =:= log_header
 1447:        andalso erlang:element(3,LogH) >= "1.0" ->
 1448:     traverse_dcd({Cont,Rest},Log,Fun);
 1449: traverse_dcd({Cont,Recs},Log,Fun) ->
 1450:     {Cont,Recs,Log,Fun}.
 1451: 
 1452: 
 1453: check_qlc_hrl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1454:     St = {r1,false,dum},
 1455:     foo = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3}], St),
 1456:     foo = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b], St),
 1457:     St = cqlc(qlc, q, [], St),
 1458:     St = cqlc(qlc, blurf, [{lc,1,2,3},b], St),
 1459:     St = cqlc(q, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b], St),
 1460:     St = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b,c], St),
 1461:     St = cqlc(qlc, q, [a,b], St),
 1462:     {r1,true,kalle} = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b], {r1,true,kalle}),
 1463:     ok.
 1464: 
 1465: %% From erl_lint.erl; original name was check_qlc_hrl/4.
 1466: cqlc(M, F, As, St) ->
 1467:     Arity = length(As),
 1468:     case As of
 1469:         [{lc,_L,_E,_Qs}|_] when M =:= qlc, F =:= q,
 1470:                                 Arity < 3,
 1471:                                 not (((element(1, St) =:= r1) orelse fail) and (size(St) =:= 3) and element(2, St)) ->
 1472:             foo;
 1473:         _ ->
 1474:             St
 1475:     end.
 1476: 
 1477: %% OTP-7679: Thanks to Hunter Morris.
 1478: andalso_semi(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1479:     ok = andalso_semi_foo(0),
 1480:     ok = andalso_semi_foo(1),
 1481:     fc(catch andalso_semi_foo(2)),
 1482: 
 1483:     ok = andalso_semi_bar([a,b,c]),
 1484:     ok = andalso_semi_bar(1),
 1485:     fc(catch andalso_semi_bar([a,b])),
 1486:     ok.
 1487: 
 1488: andalso_semi_foo(Bar) when is_integer(Bar) andalso Bar =:= 0; Bar =:= 1 ->
 1489:     ok.
 1490: 
 1491: andalso_semi_bar(Bar) when is_list(Bar) andalso length(Bar) =:= 3; Bar =:= 1 ->
 1492:     ok.
 1493: 
 1494: 
 1495: t_tuple_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1496:     10 = do_tuple_size({1,2,3,4}),
 1497:     fc(catch do_tuple_size({1,2,3})),
 1498:     fc(catch do_tuple_size(42)),
 1499: 
 1500:     error = ludicrous_tuple_size({a,b,c}),
 1501:     error = ludicrous_tuple_size([a,b,c]),
 1502: 
 1503:     ok.
 1504: 
 1505: do_tuple_size(T) when tuple_size(T) =:= 4 ->
 1506:     {A,B,C,D} = T,
 1507:     A+B+C+D.
 1508: 
 1509: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 1510:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#7777777777777777777777777777777777 -> ok;
 1511: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 1512:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#10000000000000000 -> ok;
 1513: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 1514:   when tuple_size(T) =:= (1 bsl 64) - 1 -> ok;
 1515: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 1516:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF -> ok;
 1517: ludicrous_tuple_size(_) -> error.
 1518: 
 1519: %%
 1520: %% The binary_part/2,3 guard BIFs
 1521: %%
 1522: -define(MASK_ERROR(EXPR),mask_error((catch (EXPR)))).
 1523: mask_error({'EXIT',{Err,_}}) ->
 1524:     Err;
 1525: mask_error(Else) ->
 1526:     Else.
 1527: 
 1528: %% Tests the binary_part/2,3 guard (GC) bif's.
 1529: binary_part(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1530:     %% This is more or less a copy of what the guard_SUITE in emulator
 1531:     %% does to cover the guard bif's
 1532:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>),
 1533:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>),
 1534:     error = bptest(<<1>>),
 1535:     error = bptest(<<>>),
 1536:     error = bptest(apa),
 1537:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>),
 1538:     %% With one variable (pos)
 1539:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1),
 1540:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1),
 1541:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1),
 1542:     error = bptest(<<>>,1),
 1543:     error = bptest(apa,1),
 1544:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1),
 1545:     %% With one variable (length)
 1546:     1 = bptesty(<<1,2,3>>,1),
 1547:     2 = bptesty(<<2,1,3>>,1),
 1548:     error = bptesty(<<1>>,1),
 1549:     error = bptesty(<<>>,1),
 1550:     error = bptesty(apa,1),
 1551:     3 = bptesty(<<2,3,3>>,2),
 1552:     %% With one variable (whole tuple)
 1553:     1 = bptestx(<<1,2,3>>,{1,1}),
 1554:     2 = bptestx(<<2,1,3>>,{1,1}),
 1555:     error = bptestx(<<1>>,{1,1}),
 1556:     error = bptestx(<<>>,{1,1}),
 1557:     error = bptestx(apa,{1,1}),
 1558:     3 = bptestx(<<2,3,3>>,{1,2}),
 1559:     %% With two variables
 1560:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
 1561:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
 1562:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1,1),
 1563:     error = bptest(<<>>,1,1),
 1564:     error = bptest(apa,1,1),
 1565:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
 1566:     %% Direct (autoimported) call, these will be evaluated by the compiler...
 1567:     <<2>> = binary_part(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
 1568:     <<1>> = binary_part(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
 1569:     %% Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
 1570:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<1>>,1,1)),
 1571:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<>>,1,1)),
 1572:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(apa,1,1)),
 1573:     <<3,3>> = binary_part(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
 1574:     %% Direct call through apply
 1575:     <<2>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1,2,3>>,1,1]),
 1576:     <<1>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,1,3>>,1,1]),
 1577:     %% Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
 1578:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1>>,1,1])),
 1579:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<>>,1,1])),
 1580:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[apa,1,1])),
 1581:     <<3,3>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,3,3>>,1,2]),
 1582:     %% Constant propagation
 1583:     Bin = <<1,2,3>>,
 1584:     ok = if
 1585: 	     binary_part(Bin,1,1) =:= <<2>> ->
 1586: 		 ok;
 1587: 	     %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
 1588: 	     true ->
 1589: 		 error
 1590: 	 end,
 1591:     ok = if
 1592: 	     binary_part(Bin,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1593: 		 ok;
 1594: 	     %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
 1595: 	     true ->
 1596: 		 error
 1597: 	 end,
 1598:     ok.
 1599: 
 1600: 
 1601: bptest(B) when length(B) =:= 1337 ->
 1602:     1;
 1603: bptest(B) when binary_part(B,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1604:     1;
 1605: bptest(B) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,1) =:= <<1>> ->
 1606:     2;
 1607: bptest(B)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1608:     3;
 1609: bptest(_) ->
 1610:     error.
 1611: 
 1612: bptest(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 1613:     1;
 1614: bptest(B,A) when binary_part(B,{A,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1615:     1;
 1616: bptest(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,1) =:= <<1>> ->
 1617:     2;
 1618: bptest(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1619:     3;
 1620: bptest(_,_) ->
 1621:     error.
 1622: 
 1623: bptestx(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 1624:     1;
 1625: bptestx(B,A) when binary_part(B,A) =:= <<2>> ->
 1626:     1;
 1627: bptestx(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<1>> ->
 1628:     2;
 1629: bptestx(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1630:     3;
 1631: bptestx(_,_) ->
 1632:     error.
 1633: 
 1634: bptesty(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 1635:     1;
 1636: bptesty(B,A) when binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1637:     1;
 1638: bptesty(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,A) =:= <<1>> ->
 1639:     2;
 1640: bptesty(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1641:     3;
 1642: bptesty(_,_) ->
 1643:     error.
 1644: 
 1645: bptest(B,A,_C) when length(B) =:= A ->
 1646:     1;
 1647: bptest(B,A,C) when binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1648:     1;
 1649: bptest(B,A,C) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,C) =:= <<1>> ->
 1650:     2;
 1651: bptest(B,A,C)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1652:     3;
 1653: bptest(_,_,_) ->
 1654:     error.
 1655: 
 1656: -define(FAILING(C),
 1657: 	if
 1658: 	    C -> ct:fail(should_fail);
 1659: 	    true -> ok
 1660: 	end,
 1661: 	if
 1662: 	    true, C -> ct:fail(should_fail);
 1663: 	    true -> ok
 1664: 	end).
 1665: 
 1666: bad_constants(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1667:     ?FAILING(false),
 1668:     ?FAILING([]),
 1669:     ?FAILING([a]),
 1670:     ?FAILING([Config]),
 1671:     ?FAILING({a,b}),
 1672:     ?FAILING({a,Config}),
 1673:     ?FAILING(<<1>>),
 1674:     ?FAILING(42),
 1675:     ?FAILING(3.14),
 1676:     ok.
 1677: 
 1678: %% Call this function to turn off constant propagation.
 1679: id(I) -> I.
 1680: 
 1681: check(F, Result) ->
 1682:     case F() of
 1683: 	Result -> ok;
 1684: 	Other ->
 1685: 	    io:format("Expected: ~p\n", [Result]),
 1686: 	    io:format("     Got: ~p\n", [Other]),
 1687: 	    ct:fail(failed)
 1688:     end.
 1689: 
 1690: fc({'EXIT',{function_clause,_}}) -> ok.
